sense.name: a final result, achievement
sense.examples: This product was the culmination of 13 years of research and development. Her fatigue was the culmination of weeks of stress and sleep deprivation.

sense.name: a decisive, climactic concluding event
sense.examples: The culmination of the play is when the princess thrusts the dagger into the sorcerer. I missed the culmination of the season which featured a young violinist from Berlin.

sense.name: the highest position of a celestial body relative to an observer on earth
sense.examples: This chart shows the culmination of Venus during the month of December.
